New Records: Juan Soto broke the record with a three-run home run in the 10th inning.
The New York Yankees advanced to their 41st World Series.
The Cleveland Guardians ended their playoff run with a record-breaking 15-year World Series drought.
Key Match Events: The game went into extra innings with Juan Soto's home run in the 10th inning.
The New York Yankees won the series in five games.
Pre-Game Insights: The Yankees' manager emphasized the importance of their bullpen performance.
Post-Match Reflections: Manager Stephen Vogt reflected on the season and the team's resilience.
Players expressed pride in the victory and the team's journey.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Yankees' victory marked their first World Series appearance in 15 years.
The game was a significant moment in their playoff push.
